docs.lead_paragraph: A 22-year-old University of Wisconsin student who has snorted cocaine, been strung out on amphetamine, taken something like 60 trips on LSD, and run through the whole range of synthetic drugs, has found a new way to get high.

headline.main: Many on Campus Shifting to Softer Drugs and Alcohol

docs.abstract: NY Times survey, based on interviews with students on campuses throughout nation, finds that most students are shifting to softer drugs and alcohol in lieu of hard drugs
docs.snippet: A 22-year-old University of Wisconsin student who has snorted cocaine, been strung out on amphetamine, taken something like 60 trips on LSD, and run through the whole range of synthetic drugs, has found a new way to get high.
